result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin M Cervantes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Austin M Cervantes appeared by video.  Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin appeared by video for Austin M Cervantes.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Review Hearing. Defendant has completed inpatient treatment, letter of apology, and essay. Defendant needs to complete testing and payment of restitution in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Defendant is to have no violent contact with BLC.


Court declined to sign no contact order. No violent contact remains.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed. Defendant needs to be BOOKED AND RELEASED by September 9th, 2022 by 5:00 pm.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Defendant Austin M Cervantes in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Austin M Cervantes appeared by video means with Attorney.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; No Contact Order
Received and Filed. Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights / Addendum
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 6/28/22 @ 2:30p
